description: General design system terminology and concepts

values.label: Design Token
values.description: A named entity that stores visual design attributes

definition.description: A named variable that stores a visual design attribute (color, spacing, typography, etc.) to enable consistent, scalable design
essentialCharacteristics: Named for semantic meaning rather than visual appearance
Can reference other tokens to create a hierarchy
Platform-agnostic - can be transformed for different outputs
Single source of truth for design decisions

terminology.namingRationale: Industry-standard term from Design Tokens Community Group

values.label: Superordinate
values.description: A higher-level category or class that a concept belongs to

definition.description: A word or phrase that describes a higher-level order or category within a system of classification
essentialCharacteristics: Used as the anchor in definition writing
Sets context for what class of thing is being defined
Helps readers understand the broader category
Critical for writing strong, clear definitions

terminology.namingRationale: Technical term from terminology management and linguistics

sources.reference: Spectrum Naming and Definition Writing Guide

values.label: Essential Characteristic
values.description: A key feature that distinguishes a concept from others

definition.description: A distinguishing feature or attribute that helps define what a concept is and how it differs from related concepts
essentialCharacteristics: Specifies unique or defining properties
Helps differentiate from similar concepts
Part of a complete definition structure
Should be specific and observable

terminology.namingRationale: Standard term in terminology management and definition writing

sources.reference: Spectrum Naming and Definition Writing Guide

values.label: Descriptive Language
values.description: A short phrase that explains a complex concept

definition.description: A short phrase or sentence used to explain a concept when a single word or term is insufficient or unclear
essentialCharacteristics: Used when concepts are too complex for one word
Provides clarity over brevity
Especially useful for context-dependent concepts
Preferred over forcing a single-word name

terminology.namingRationale: Spectrum naming methodology advocates for descriptive language when needed

sources.reference: Spectrum Naming and Definition Writing Guide

values.label: Multi-Platform Design System
values.description: A design system that supports multiple platforms with shared principles but platform-specific implementations

definition.description: A design system where multiple platforms are supported with implementations that may differ, but all follow core principles and shared terminology
essentialCharacteristics: More than one platform is supported
Implementation can differ across platforms
Not all UI code is shared across platforms
Things need to feel the same but not necessarily look identical
Shared terminology by default, but platform-specific terms are acceptable

terminology.namingRationale: Describes Spectrum's architectural approach to supporting web, iOS, Android, Qt, etc.

sources.reference: Spectrum Naming and Definition Writing Guide - Multi-platform section
